metadata.title: CVE-2021-28374 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
The Debian courier-authlib package before 0.71.1-2 for CourierAuthentication Library creates a /run/courier/authdaemon directory withweak permissions, allowing an attacker to read user information. This mayinclude a cleartext password in some configurations. In general, itincludes the user's existence, uid and gids, home and/or Maildir directory,quota, and some type of password information (such as a hash).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28374` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

courier-authdaemon - 0.71.4-1
courier-authlib - 0.71.4-1
courier-authlib-ldap - 0.71.4-1
courier-authlib-mysql - 0.71.4-1
courier-authlib-pipe - 0.71.4-1
courier-authlib-postgresql - 0.71.4-1
courier-authlib-sqlite - 0.71.4-1
courier-authlib-userdb - 0.71.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: courier-authlib package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.71.4-1').
